products.title: August Kesseler, The Daily Pinot Noir
products.description:
Widely considered the benchmark winemaker of the Rheingau region of Germany, August Kessler took over his family vineyards in the late 1970s and has since passed down production to a new generation of German winemakers. Coincidentally, these days Kessler spends a large portion of his time in Chicago where he works on supporting his wines throughout the country. The Daily August was created by a young winemaker in hopes of making a wine that was approachable yet elegant for the everyday drinker. Spoiler alert: it totally delivers. 

Rheingau 2015 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Belle Glos, Pinot Noir Las Alturas
products.description:
A rich, deep pinot noir packed with flavors of blackberries, bing cherries and dark chocolate with hints of vanilla and cedar oak. Smooth and slightly earthy this full-bodied California red is delicious with fresh salmon, lamb or a juicy steak.

California 2016 | 14.5% ABV

products.title: Domaine Serene Yamhill Cuveé Pinot Noir
products.description:
Alluring and rich, with silky flavors of cherry, blackberry, sarsaparilla and a note of spice.

Willamette Valley 2013 | 13.0% ABV

products.title: Elouan, Pinot Noir
products.description:
This rich, full-bodied wine is bursting with flavors of ripe cranberry, sweet cinnamon and fresh cherry. Aged ten months in French oak barrels for a delicate and crisp finish. 

Oregon 2015 | 13.7% ABV

products.title: Folly of the Beast, Pinot Noir
products.description:
This bright, round-tannined red is aged in new and neutral French oak to enhance the notes of sweet spice in this full-bodied Pinot.

California 2015 | 14.8% ABV

products.title: Gönc, Pinot Noir
products.description:
Vineyards with great drainage = thirsty grapes. Thirsty grapes battle for survival, creating fruit of great character, and this Pinot is a perfect example of that character. Complex with a great sense of place, this is a great food wine or for enjoying on a cool patio. 

The Gonc Famiy Farm was converted to vineyards in the 1930s, and today is operated by the great grandson of the original owner, Pete Gonc. Heavily involved in the community, @goncwinery is a must follow on Instagram and Facebook for a look behind the scenes!

Slovania 2017 | 13% ABV

products.title: Grochau Cellar, Commuter Cuvee Pinot Noir
products.description:
This ready to drink Commuter Cuvee is a stand out Willamette Pinot Noir. Another great wine that represents its home and people, the grapes are allowed to fully ripen before spending time with oxygen in neutral French oak to further prepare it for your glasses.

Willamette 2016 | 14.1% ABV

products.title: Lulumi, Pinot Noir
products.description:
Every bottle of wine tells a story - they’re filled with the uniqueness of a place, a year of sun and rain, and the craft of winemaking. Lulumi wines are not only inspired by this idea of story, but also the French country lifestyle - this Pinot Noir is aged in only neutral French barrique, creating a ‘light old world’ approach that’s both relaxed and pleasing.

Pay d’OC 2016 | 13% ABV

products.title: Point North, Pinot Noir
products.description:
Medium-bodied with aromas of blackberry and black pepper, and flavors of dark fruit, raspberry and spice.

Oregon 2013 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Rickshaw, Pinot Noir
products.description:
Bright notes of dried cherry and pine with flavors of wild strawberry, red plum and pomegranate. 

California 2014 | 14.1% ABV

products.title: Scribe, Nouveau
products.description:
From one of our favorite winemakers, Scribe transforms its California pinot noir grapes into a bright, American interpretation of the Beaujolais Nouveau style - exemplifying the kind of light bodied, fruity and acidic red that's our go-to bottle for those Thanksgiving spreads or just a snowy winter night at home. Only a few cases of this v limited release were sent to Chicago, so you'll want to snag your bottles soon. Like right now.

Sonoma, CA 2018 | 12.0% ABV

products.title: Scribe, Pinot Noir
products.description:
Rich and fresh with bright fruit flavors, a touch of spice and a natural earthiness before being aged in oak barrels for six months for a softer, more delicate Pinot Noir.

Sonoma, CA 2016 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Two Kings, Pinot Noir
products.description:
A bright, approachable pinot noir with notes of strawberry, black cherry and a hint of sweet smokiness. Crafted by former Sommelier Matt Ahern, this velvety red is perfect as your new house pinot noir.

Sonoma County, CA 2016 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Experience Napa, Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
When all you want is a sunny getaway from this tundra, get by with a little help from this smooth, rich Cabernet with flavors of sweet blackberry, black pepper and cedar, and a lingering, spicy finish. Pour, enjoy and repeat until summer.

Napa Valley 2014 | 14.0% ABV

products.title: Field Recordings, Cabernet Franc
products.description:
While spending his days working as a nurseryman for vineyards across the US, Field Recordings winemaker Andrew Jones has been able to source grapes from some of America’s best kept secrets - like this Cabernet Franc from the cool climate vineyards around Paso Robles. The wine is light on its feet, but perfectly suitable for any Cabernet drinker. Like all of Andrew’s wines, this is a representation of the future movement of winemaking in California.

Paso Robles 2016  | 12.9% ABV

products.title: Grapesmith & Crusher, Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
A smooth, throwback of a Cab with notes of blackberry, black currant, dark chocolate and coffee. Try this dry, full-bodied red with meaty meals such as grilled lamb chops or a juicy burger.

Washington 2015 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Hayes Valley, Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
Pure, unadulterated California Cabernet made with grapes from one of the first sustainable vineyards in Monterey Valley.

Monterey Valley 2016 | 14.2% ABV

products.title: Hunt & Harvest, Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
A juicy, fruit forward Cab layered with aromas of red, blue and black berry fruits and rounded out by flavors of blackcurrant and a touch of oak before finishing with a touch of sweet vanilla.

Napa Valley 2015 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Neverland, Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
A newer label from Field Recordings winemaker Andrew Jones, most of the grapes for this Cab are sourced from private vineyards in Happy Valley California that run along Michael Jackson’s Neverland Ranch. If you like Valley Cabernet, don’t think twice about adding this to your cart.

Paso Robles 2017  | 13.9% ABV

products.title: No Fine Print, Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
Crafted by local sommelier Ryan Arnold  + friends (who also happen to be the managers behind Chance the Rapper and Skrillex), this California cab is juicy, delicious and packed with dark fruit flavor. Pair with a good record and even better company.

California 2016 | 14.5% ABV

products.title: Paratus, Mount Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon 2010
products.description:
Imagine the beautiful green landscape of mountains; the low hanging clouds trapped inside the hills; the smell of pine, eucalyptus and damp soil. Breathtaking wine like this Paratus Cabernet exemplify the strong, transformative connection between wine and earth - this universally appealing bottle will transform you to another place - a must enjoy.

Mt. Veeder Napa 2010 | 14.5% ABV

products.title: Quilt, Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
Sourced from a patchwork of prime Napa Valley vineyards, this is a rich and satisfying cab with flavors of hazelnut, cocoa, blackberry preserves and vanilla. 

Napa Valley 2014 | 15.0%  ABV

products.title: Rough Day, Cabernet Sauvignon
products.description:
Rough Day? Here’s something to take the edge off - this highly aromatic Cabernet expresses fruit in the Bordeaux style, and pairs perfectly with cheesy snacks or a hearty meal.

Bulgaria 2014 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Esporão Alandra, Red Blend
products.description:
Made from Portugal's best grape varieties and then aged in stainless steel tanks, this young, fruity wine bursts with rich, velvety flavors of red berry.

Portugal 2015 | 13.0% ABV

products.title: Fatty Pope, Red Blend
products.description:
Invite the pope over for dinner - he enjoys a nice grilled steak or chicken with roasted veggies and chocolate cake. You fancy, pope. This Paso Robles red blend with bold, jammy flavors is the latest addition to chef Fabio Viviani's lineup of wines tailored to elevate any meal.

Paso Robles, CA 2015 | 14.9% ABV

products.title: Fausse Piste, Pizza Sauce
products.description:
Crafted with Rhone varietals from across the Pacific Northwest, this juicy bottle is a blend of Malbec, Syrah, Grenache and Pinot Noir. And call us Captain Obvious, but this is *probably* a good wine to enjoy at your next pizza night. Something about it just says ‘za...

Washington NV | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Folk Machine, Parts and Labor Red Blend
products.description:
A hodgepodge of California grapes including Syrah, Grenache, Carignan and Barbera, this bottle is perfect for those that love a dry red wine. The wines of Folk Machine come from the same producer as Hobo wines, many of which have garnered impressive critical acclaim. 

California 2016 | 12.7% ABV

products.title: Orin Swift, Machete Red Blend
products.description:
Aromas of ripe blueberries, candied plum and toasted oak flow into flavors of ripe boysenberry and charred vanilla.

St. Helena, CA 2014 | 15.7% ABV

products.title: Orin Swift, Napa Valley Palermo
products.description:
A full-bodied blend of Cabernet, Merlot and Cab Franc grapes with hints of cocoa, blackberry and juicy dark fruits layered with a smooth, minerality and well developed tannins. 

California 2016 | 15.4% ABV

products.title: The Whole Shebang, Red Blend
products.description:
A peppery, juicy, multi-vintage red blend with flavors of red currant, blackberry and clove. 

California | 14.2% ABV

products.title: Chateau Recougne, Bordeaux Supérieur
products.description:
A spicy, fruity, medium-bodied wine full of juicy blackberry and vanilla notes and a hint of smoky flavor from aging in wood barrels. Pairs perfectly with grilled meats or poultry.

France | 13.0% ABV

products.title: Clos Cibonne, Rouge Tentations
products.description:
When you think Provence, rosé is probably the first thing that comes to mind - but while it’s home to some of the world’s most notable rosés, they also make powerful, juicy red wines like this rouge with great aromatics of rosemary, thyme and oregano. 

Provence 2016 | 14.5% ABV

products.title: Clovis, Côtes du Rhône Rouge
products.description:
Primarily made of Syrah, this blend uses grapes from 30 year old vines in the Languedoc of France, and thanks to both aromas that lend themselves to natural winemaking techniques and high production standards at the family-operated Clovis, this bottle is a wonderful representation of Rhone varietals.

Languedoc-Roussillon 2015 | 14% ABV

products.title: Discover France
products.description:
Drink your way through some of the most notable wine growing regions in world - Burgundy, Bordeaux, and Cote du Rhone - with this French lineup. Oui oui.

Package Includes:
- Domain Saint Cyr, Beaujolais la Galoche Gamay
- Chateau Recougne, Bourdeaux
- Clovis, Côtes du Rhône Rouge

products.title: Domain Saint Cyr, Beaujolais la Galoche Gamay
products.description:
Looking for a Beaujolais Gamay? Here’s our pick! After a new winemaker took over the wines of Pierre Saint Cyr in 2008, all the vineyards switched to organic viticulture, making Domaine Saint Cyr the largest organic vineyard in Beaujolais. If you’re new to wines from this southernmost region of Burgundy, expect a wine that’s fruitier, with softer tannins than a Pinot Noir. 

Beaujolais 2017 | 13% ABV

products.title: Domaine du Vieux Télégraphe, Châteauneuf-du-Pape Rouge
products.description:
Lovers of the Châteauneuf-du-Pape AOC need no introduction to Vieux Télégraphe, one of the most storied winemakers in the premier appellation of the Rhone Valley. Like most Châteauneuf-du-Pape rouge, this wine is made primarily with Grenache Noir, but incorporates varying degrees of Mourvèdre and Syrah for a depth of elegance and spice, plus juicy aromatics of herbs de provence. 

Rhône 2014 | 14.5% ABV

products.title: Isle Saint-Pierre, Méditerranée Rouge
products.description:
A small island in the middle of the Rhone River only 15km from the sea, the Isle Saint-Pierre is known for its simple, charming wines with great value. This Méditerranée Rouge is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot.

Rhône 2016 | 12.5% ABV

products.title: Mommessin, Beaujolais Nouveau
products.description:
Always released the third Thursday of every November, the French tradition of Beaujolais Nouveau has been adopted here as the quintessential Thanksgiving wine, and for good reason. The light bodied, fruity and acidic red pairs perfectly with everything from turkey + all the fixins to those crisp snowy nights. Our suggestion? Don't wait to hit *add to cart* - this damn good juice goes quick.

Burgundy, France 2018 | 12.0% ABV

products.title: Cocci Grifoni, Montepulciano San Basso Rosso Piceno
products.description:
Though Cocci Grifoni’s white wines are historic, essentially reviving the Pecorino grape from extinction, they make equally wonderful Chianti with Montepulciano and Sangiovese grapes. The wine balances old and new world styles, and is a great introduction into the category.

Chianti 2014 | 13% ABV

products.title: La Miraja, Le Masche Barbera D'Asti
products.description:
Previously never exported outside of Northern Italy, we have native Minnesotan, Weston Hoard, to thank for bringing this brilliant wine stateside. Steeped in history, the vineyard is known to be the oldest in the area, with the winemaking done in an 11th century(!) castle. Expect a vibrant and bright expression of Barbara in this bottle.

Piedmont 2015  | 14% ABV

products.title: Oddero, Barolo
products.description:
Sharing similar recognition to premier regions like Bordeaux and Burgundy, a large portion of Piedmont’s most premium vineyards are owned and operated by Oddero, who is producing some of the world’s most captivating wines. Lay it down or enjoy it now, impress your friends or treat yourself - you won’t find a more legitimate expression of Barolo than Oddero.

Piedmont 2013  | 14% ABV

products.title: Puianello, Lambrusco Reggioano Rosso Amabile
products.description:
A slightly effervescent red wine hailing from Emilia-Romagna Italy, there’s no better wine for cool nights outside than Lambrusco. Low in alcohol, off-dry and easy to drink, this wine is perfect for fans of sangria who are looking for something with more purity and less sugar.
 
Emilia-Romagna 2017 | 8.5% ABV

products.title: Rapido, Sangiovese
products.description:
The primary grape found in Chianti Classico, this Sangiovese is ripe and juicy - perfect for fans of warmer climate wines. Great for pasta night, this particular wine is produced in Puglia, the heel of Italy’s boot. 

Puglia 2017 | 13% ABV

products.title: Tenuta Di Sticciano, Chianti
products.description:
Ripe with soft tannins, this Chianti is a perfect example of the intersection of passion, quality and value. Home to a 400 year old hunting lodge in the forests of Tuscany, the stunning Tenuta di Sticciano estate’s winery is a passion project of the owner, who cares deeply for organic viticulture and sustainability.

Chianti 2014 | 13% ABV

products.title: Vietti, Langhe Nebbiolo Perbacco
products.description:
Located in the heart of Piedmont’s famous Langhe region, Perbacco is produced only with nebbiolo from plots in Barolo, with the same winemaking process as their single vineyard expressions - the only difference? This wine spends a slightly shorter time in the barrel. If you love the full bodied and concentrated wines of Piedmont, this is a great buy for the value. 

Piedmont 2015  | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Bardos, Romántica Tempranillo
products.description:
Made in collaboration with famed winemaker Raúl Acha, this bottle is a great gateway for those that love Napa wines, but want to explore other grapes and regions. This particular expression of Tempranillo is made in one of the warmer climates in the region, which creates an even juicier red. Quick vintage note: 2015 was an awesome year in Spain. Get this while you can. 

Castilla y Leon 2015 | 14% ABV

products.title: Hacienda Lopez de Haro, Rioja Crianza
products.description:
The youngest Rioja designated wine made by celebrated winemaker Raúl Acha, this wine is made from primarily tempranillo grapes and spends about 18 months in a blend of new French and American oak. This bottle is packed with flavors of vanilla, cocoa, dark fruit and touch of oak. Pair with hearty meals such as sausage, stews, roasted vegetables or a cool night around a bonfire.

Rioja, Spain 2015 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: Opici, Rioja la Maldita Garnacha
products.description:
For 75 years, the Opici name on a label has stood for value and quality. The Opicis have always sought a quality level comparable to the brand leaders, but at a more reasonable price. Today, the tradition of offering affordable, everyday wines continues.

Spain 2017 | 13% ABV

products.title: Proyecto Garnacha de España, Salvaja del Moncayo Grenache
products.description:
From famed winemaker Raúl Acha, the Garnacha Project of Spain is a special label created with the aim to bring global attention to one of the country’s primary grape varietals. When Raúl first discovered these 50+ year old vines, they were growing wild; today they’ve gained critical acclaim at an exponential rate as one of the top wines of Spain.

Ebro Valley 2016 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: San Isidro, Organic Sangria
products.description:
Packed with Monsatrelle grapes, lemons and oranges all organically farmed at the vineyard, this dry sangria is perfect for entertaining this season - enjoy it chilled on its own, or heat it up with a dash of spices for an amazing hot cocktail.

Spain | 7.0% ABV

products.title: Alamos, Malbec
products.description:
A classically Argentine wine, Alamos Malbec blends deep plum flavor with the dark cherry and blackberry flavors of Syrah and Bonarda. Hints of brown sugar and vanilla make this Malbec unforgettable. 

Argentina 2013 | 13.5% ABV

products.title: DiamAndes Perlita, Malbec-Syrah
products.description:
A full bodied, beautifully layered red with flavors of dark chocolate, berry and light vanilla. 

Argentina 2013 | 14.5% ABV

products.title: La Posta, Paulucci Malbec
products.description:
This prolific, high elevation Malbec from Mendoza is made in collaboration with a true modern day renaissance woman, Laura Catena. A fourth generation Argentinian vinter, Laura is the founder and managing director of the Catena Institute of Wine, the author of the critically acclaimed book Vino Argentino, and nbd, also a part-time practicing physician in San Francisco 👊

Mendoza 2016 | 12.5% ABV

products.title: Reunion, Malbec
products.description:
A deep, full-bodied wine packed with flavors of ripe plum, juicy cherry and layered with notes of chocolate. Soft and velvety, it's an easy-drinking red with a long, smooth finish.

Argentina 2016 | 14.0% ABV

products.title: Beran, Sonoma County Zinfandel
products.description:
Aromas of blueberry pie, raspberry and dark chocolate are complemented by hints of vanilla and toasted oak for a rich, elegant wine with a peppery spice and a long finish.

Sonoma County 2013 | 15.3% ABV

products.title: Crane Assembly, Disciples Zinfandel Blend
products.description:
A blend of 95% Zinfandel and 5% Petite Syrah, this is a young, big Napa red with aromas of brambly fruit, mixed berry cobbler, forest floor and smoke.

Napa Valley 2016 | 15.7% ABV

products.title: Tilth, Zinfandel
products.description:
A luscious, full-bodied Zin bursting with flavors of juicy black cherry, pomegranate, a hint of cardamom and layered with soft tannins before finishing long and smooth.

California 2016 | 14.8% ABV

products.title: Duckhorn, Napa Valley Merlot
products.description:
A classic Napa Valley Merlot, this wine layers flavors of ripe cherry, plum and black fig with hints of leather and cedar. Lush and smooth, velvety tannins are balanced by notes of raspberry, coffee and chocolate that carry through to the long finish.

Napa Valley 2014 | 14.5% ABV

products.title: Discover Cabernet
products.description:
A trio of fun Cabs including a juicy California red; a smooth, dry Washington wine and a highly aromatic Cabernet made in Bulgaria.

Package Includes:
- Grapesmith & Crusher, Cabernet Sauvignon
- Rough Day, Cabernet Sauvignon
- No Fine Print, Cabernet Sauvignon

products.title: Discover France
products.description:
Drink your way through some of the most notable wine growing regions in world - Burgundy, Bordeaux, and Cote du Rhone - with this French lineup. Oui oui.

Package Includes:
- Domain Saint Cyr, Beaujolais la Galoche Gamay
- Chateau Recougne, Bourdeaux
- Clovis, Côtes du Rhône Rouge

products.title: Discover Pinot Noir
products.description:
Three delicious, unique styles of Pinot Noir including a light, earthy style from Central France, an Oregon wine from one of the fastest growing wineries in the Willamette region and a Slovenian wine made with vines that have been producing since the 1930's.

Package Includes:
- Gönc, Pinot Noir
- Lulumi, Pinot Noir
- Grochau Cellar, Commuter Cuvee Pinot Noir
